ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to self-guide and mointor research into a topic I'm interested in under the direction of an advisor. I also learned about quantum physics and philosophy.
I have learned advanced writing methods and alternative views for seeking everything out of the texts I am using for sources.
I continued to build on my thesis and am in an excellent position to finish my thesis this spring.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a one-on-one seminar for my senior essay, and thus this kind of feedback doesn't apply to this course.
The one on one with Prof. Markovits is a gift.
I appreciated the opportunity to meet weekly with Professor Freedman to run my ideas by him, as well as get his advice. Meeting weekly also helped hold me accountable to meet my thesis writing goals.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a requirement for my individual Humanities major senior essay and thus this kind of feedback doesn't apply for this course.
Yes! Working on my thesis has been such a rewarding process. I've appreciated the opportunity to contribute knowledge, as well as take in knowledge.
